item.title: iCal2Notion
item.description: Earlier this year I decided that I needed some sort of hub for the tasks and events in my life. I decided at that point to go with Notion (although I have now switched to org-mode in emacs). One feature that notion is lacking is the ability to pull in events from Google Calendar into a database. I noticed that there were no tools that did this so I decided to roll my own.

item.title: Python Docstring
item.description: Emacs Emacs is an incredibly extensible editor. It is one of the two major players in the unix "poweruser" editor wars. It is both configured and extended in elisp, an emacs-specific dialect of lisp. The main benefit I see of using Emacs is how I can easily add functionality I find that I need. Python Docstring At work currently I am writing a lot of python.
